newsitem.title: USA: VMARK Software says Q3 sales to shrink.
newsitem.headline: VMARK Software says Q3 sales to shrink.

text.p: VMARK Software Inc said on Wednesday it expects its third-quarter sales to be about 8 percent below analysts' expectations, resulting in marginal profitability for the period.
VMARK said analysts expected it to earn about $0.11 per share on revenues of about $17.9 million for the third quarter, which ended September 29.
The estimated third-quarter results compare to revenue of $15.6 million, with a loss of $0.13 per share, for the third quarter in 1995.
In this year's second quarter, the company recorded $17.9 million in revenue, posting a profit of $0.11 per share.
Results from this year's third quarter are expected to be released on October 22.
